recipe_name: Roasted Cumberland sausage with swede and potato mash
author: James Tanner
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the sausage, rub the sausage with the oil and place on a small baking tray. Place into the oven and roast for 15-20 minutes, or until completely cooked through. To make the mash, place the cooked potato and swede into a bowl and mash with a potato masher or a ricer. Add the butter, garlic and cream, season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper and stir to mix. To serve, place the mash in the centre of a warm plate with the roasted Cumberland sausage on top.
ingredients: 1 Cumberland sausage ring,  1 tbsp olive oil,  1 potato, peeled, chopped, cooked in boiling water and drained,  ½ swede, peeled, chopped, cooked in boiling water and drained,  50g/1¾oz unsalted butter,  ½ clove garlic, finely chopped,  50ml/2fl oz double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
